data.title: Original photograph of Marie Prevost, circa 1920s
data.meta_description: N.p. N.p., Circa 1920s. Vintage double weight oversize matte borderless portrait photograph of actress Marie Prevost, circa 1920s. With a brief mimeo snipe and the stamp of photographer Edward Thayer Monroe on the verso.Canadian-born Prevost began her film career as a Mack Sennett Bathing Beauty in 1917, but found her breakthrough role in Yankee Doodle in Berlin 1918 . The actress was best known for her light comedies with Universal and Warner
data.text:
Marie Prevost (subject)

Edward Thayer Monroe (photographer)

N.p. N.p., Circa 1920s. Vintage double weight oversize matte borderless portrait photograph of actress Marie Prevost, circa 1920s. With a brief mimeo snipe and the stamp of photographer Edward Thayer Monroe on the verso.

Canadian-born Prevost began her film career as a Mack Sennett "Bathing Beauty" in 1917, but found her breakthrough role in "Yankee Doodle in Berlin" (1918). The actress was best known for her light comedies with Universal and Warner Brothers, most notably with director Ernst Lubitch, including "The Marriage Circle" (1924), "Three Women" (1924) and "Kiss Me Again" (1925).

8.25 x 10 inches. Very Good plus, with light edgewear and light, even toning.

[Book #148142]
